articles.headline: Justice Department Is Said to Investigate Cable Companies Over Internet Video
articles.snippet: At issue is whether caps on Internet data use imposed by cable companies are anticompetitive because they limit access to online video — and thus force consumers to have cable subscriptions.
articles.abstract: At issue is whether caps on Internet data use imposed by cable companies are anticompetitive because they limit access to online video — and thus force consumers to have cable subscriptions.
articles.lead_paragraph: 8:56 p.m. | Updated Another round is under way in the battle between established cable and Internet providers like Comcast and relative upstarts like Netflix. And the government is playing referee.
articles.byline: By Brian Stelter and Edward Wyatt

articles.headline: Economy’s Mixed Blessing: Commodity Prices Fall
articles.snippet: Prices for a range of goods, including cotton, copper and gasoline, have fallen in recent weeks, a sign of faltering demand.
articles.abstract: Prices for a range of goods, including cotton, copper and gasoline, have fallen in recent weeks, a sign of faltering demand.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — Mark Juull, a construction contractor for public and residential housing, has something to be thankful for in this sluggish economy: With global commodity prices falling, he’s saving $200 a week on fuel for his three trucks and finding deals on aluminum, lumber and roof shingles, which are typically made from petroleum.

articles.headline: JPMorgan’s Chief Says Clawback Efforts Are ‘Likely’
articles.snippet: In testimony before the Senate Banking Committee, Jamie Dimon assured lawmakers that the bank’s board was investigating the trading losses. Once the investigation is complete, he said, the bank will decide whose paychecks to pursue.
articles.abstract: In testimony before the Senate Banking Committee, Jamie Dimon assured lawmakers that the bank’s board was investigating the trading losses. Once the investigation is complete, he said, the bank will decide whose paychecks to pursue.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — JPMorgan Chase is “likely” to try to recover compensation from executives responsible for a recent multibillion-dollar trading blowup, according to Jamie Dimon, the bank’s chief executive.

articles.headline: MacBook, a Point Shy of Perfect
articles.snippet: Apple’s newly designed laptop looks good, starts up quickly and has a Retina display screen. And yes, it is expensive.
articles.abstract: Apple’s newly designed laptop looks good, starts up quickly and has a Retina display screen. And yes, it is expensive.
articles.lead_paragraph: If you could design your dream laptop, how would you describe it?

articles.headline: Google Wants Love and 100 Other Things
articles.snippet: Google proved to be one of the more ambitious applicants for new top level domain names, announced today. It applied for more than 100 domains, including .google, .youtube, .goog and .plus. It was the only applicant for .fly, .new and .eat. But it...
articles.abstract: Google proved to be one of the more ambitious applicants for new top level domain names, announced today. It applied for more than 100 domains, including .google, .youtube, .goog and .plus. It was the only applicant for .fly, .new and .eat. But it is going to have to fight Microsoft for .docs and .live, and Amazon for 17 top-level domains: .search, .shop, .drive, .free, .game, .mail, .map, .movie, .music, .play, .shop, .show, .spot, .store, .talk, .you and — bizarrely –.wow.
articles.lead_paragraph: Google wants love. But so do six other companies. They are after .love, actually, a new “top-level domain” that could catch on as .com, .org and .net did.
articles.byline: By Nicole Perlroth and Eric Pfanner

articles.headline: Jury Gets Insider Case of Ex-Goldman Director
articles.snippet: In final statements in the trial of the former Goldman director Rajat K. Gupta, prosecutors tried to connect the dots among reams of evidence but defense lawyers said there was no evidence of wrongdoing.
articles.abstract: In final statements in the trial of the former Goldman director Rajat K. Gupta, prosecutors tried to connect the dots among reams of evidence but defense lawyers said there was no evidence of wrongdoing.
articles.lead_paragraph: During closing arguments in the insider trading trial of Rajat K. Gupta on Wednesday, a prosecutor distilled a dizzying number of exhibits — phone records, board minutes, trading logs and e-mails — into a cogent narrative of the government’s case.
articles.byline: By Peter Lattman and Azam Ahmed

articles.headline: Copters in Syria May Not Be New, U.S. Officials Say
articles.snippet: Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton claimed that Russia shipped attack helicopters to Syria, but the shipment may have been part of routine maintenance rather than a purchase.
articles.abstract: Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton claimed that Russia shipped attack helicopters to Syria, but the shipment may have been part of routine maintenance rather than a purchase.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton accused Russia on Tuesday of shipping attack helicopters to Syria that would “escalate the conflict quite dramatically,” it was the Obama administration’s sharpest criticism yet of Russia’s support for the Syrian government.
articles.byline: By Eric Schmitt, Mark Landler and Andrew E. Kramer

articles.headline: How Broccoli Landed on Supreme Court Menu
articles.snippet: In arguments made against the Obama administration’s health care law, a thread that runs through many of them is an analogy between the health care law and broccoli.
articles.abstract: In arguments made against the Obama administration’s health care law, a thread that runs through many of them is an analogy between the health care law and broccoli.
articles.lead_paragraph: What does broccoli have to do with health insurance?

articles.headline: Campaign Aid Is Now Surging Into 8 Figures
articles.snippet: Sheldon Adelson, a billionaire casino owner, and his wife, Dr. Miriam Adelson, are by far the most prolific campaign donors in the country.
articles.abstract: Sheldon Adelson, a billionaire casino owner, and his wife, Dr. Miriam Adelson, are by far the most prolific campaign donors in the country.
articles.lead_paragraph: Even in a political season marked by unprecedented levels of political spending, Sheldon Adelson stands alone.

articles.headline: Church Battles Efforts to Ease Sex Abuse Suits
articles.snippet: The Roman Catholic Church has been resisting efforts by some state lawmakers to increase the time in which child sexual abuse cases can be brought.
articles.abstract: The Roman Catholic Church has been resisting efforts by some state lawmakers to increase the time in which child sexual abuse cases can be brought.
articles.lead_paragraph: While the first criminal trial of a Roman Catholic church official accused of covering up child sexual abuse has drawn national attention to Philadelphia, the church has been quietly engaged in equally consequential battles over abuse, not in courtrooms but in state legislatures around the country.
articles.byline: By Laurie Goodstein and Erik Eckholm

articles.headline: Blow to Transition as Court Dissolves Egypt’s Parliament
articles.snippet: A panel of judges also blessed the presidential bid of Hosni Mubarak’s last prime minister, putting Egypt’s troubled move to democracy in grave doubt.
articles.abstract: A panel of judges also blessed the presidential bid of Hosni Mubarak’s last prime minister, putting Egypt’s troubled move to democracy in grave doubt.
articles.lead_paragraph: CAIRO — A panel of judges appointed by Egypt’s ousted president, Hosni Mubarak, threw the nation’s troubled transition to democracy into grave doubt Thursday with rulings that dissolved the popularly elected Parliament and allowed the toppled government’s last prime minister to run for president, escalating a struggle by remnants of the old elite to block Islamists from coming to power.
